results.title: You're no good
results.creator_credit: John Kemeny, ONF | NFB and George Kaczender
results.brief_description: A story of the impulses of youth that often clash with society’s need for circumspection, law and order. Eddie makes the mistake of “borrowing” a motor cycle parked in front of a bike shop. He takes his girlfriend for a joy ride before the law intervenes. A commentary on a society that often offers youth little purpose or sense of accomplishment.

results.title: You're Fired
results.creator_credit: Taylormade Films, Film Victoria and John Taylor
results.brief_description: An animated film which deals with fire prevention around the home, the need to plan escape routes and what to do if fire occurs. Using a lively quiz show format featuring devilish Hot Harry, the film teaches children about fire hazards.

results.title: You're eating for two
results.creator_credit: Tom Daly, ONF | NFB and Malca Gillson
results.brief_description: This film is designed to teach pregnant women how to give birth to a healthy, happy baby. It explains what is meant by a balanced diet. It also touches upon other aspects, such as prenatal exercises and proper weight gain. The message of the film is clear: good nutrition may be as important for proper mental and physical development before birth as afterwards.

results.title: You'll soon get the hang of it
results.brief_description: Aims to impart the basic psychology of training and motivation and how to apply it when passing on knowledge and skills to a trainee. John Cleese uses a variety of situations - manual, clerical and technical - to put over the essential points and illustrate the major pitfalls.

results.title: You'll love New Orleans and she'll love you right back
results.creator_credit: Carolyn Ramsey Productions and Carolyn Ramsey
results.brief_description: Shows many aspects of New Orleans - the French style buildings, the Spanish style gardens. Looks at the sports and cultural activities, including jazz bands. Script, Carolyn Ramsey; photographer, Bill Delgado; commentator, John Pela.

results.title: You'll get yours when you're 65
results.brief_description: A look at Social Security, how it works and its effect on the nation’s aged. Questions raised include how social or how secure one can be on today’s pensions and some administration plans for the future are discussed.

results.title: Yoshi no yama: a classical Japanese dance
results.brief_description: A single dancer, by the use of masks, tells the story of three friends of different temperaments. A preface shows the application of kabuki make-up; the dance itself, a buyo dance with the stylization and refinement of the no tradition, is performed with the choreographic use of the on-stage-hand, or figure in black.
results.title_for_label: Yoshi no yama: a classical Japanese dance

results.title: Yoru no omnatachi = Women of the night
results.creator_credit: Mitsushio Shimizu, Shochiku and Kenji Mizoguchi
results.brief_description:
Women of the night’ details how two sisters are driven to prostitution by poverty. The narrative blocks out this nether world life with a well developed story which gives a moving portrayal of their lives, fraught with attempts at escape. In the film’s climax the two women are accused of being traitors to their class by the judge and jury who are fellow whores. A feminist tract, ‘Women of the night’ is a moving drama plotting the destroyed lives of two women.

Credits: Producer, Mitsushio Shimizu ; director, Kenji Mizoguchi ; writer, Yoshitaka Yoda ; photography, Shigeto Miki ; music, Hisato Osawa ; editing, Tazuko Sakane.
Cast: Kinuyo Tanaka, Sanae Takasugi, Mitsuo Nagata, Tomie Tsunoda, Kumeko Urabe, Minpei Tomimoto.

results.title: Yorkshire sands
results.creator_credit: British Transport Films and Tony Thompson
results.brief_description: Light verse and gay music make their own comment on the holiday makers of the Yorkshire coastline. Between Tees and Humber thousands each year enjoy the sea and the ands, the funfair, and the ballroom; for a row or a romance, there’s something for each.

results.title: Yorke Peninsula
results.creator_credit: South Australian Film Corporation and Ron Saunders
results.brief_description: The sea in its various moods is the central “character” in this exploration of the scenery and recreational opportunities of Yorke Peninsula in South Australia. The agricultural and mining background of this region adds a further dimension to its natural pleasures.
